definition: Fujimori (Japanese surname)/Alberto Ken'ya Fujimori (1938-), president of Peru 1990-2000

sentences.english: She beat him by a large margin in the first round of voting.
sentences.chinese: 在首轮投票中，藤森庆子大幅领先于库辛斯基。

sentences.english: Peruvian President Alberto Fujimori was elected in 1990, re-elected twice.
sentences.chinese: 藤森1990年当选秘鲁总统，两次连任。

sentences.english: Peru's President Fujimori to resign, Prime Minister says.
sentences.chinese: 秘鲁总理透露，藤森总统即将辞职。

sentences.english: At last Alberta Fujimore knew that the game was up, and let him be taken by the police.
sentences.chinese: 最后藤森知道罪行已败露，让警察把他带走了。

definition: KOIZUMI Jun'ichirō (1942-), Japanese LDP politician, prime minister 2001-2006
Suharto (1921-2008), former Indonesian general, president of the Republic of Indonesia 1967-1998
member of the US House of Representatives
Hatoyama Yukio (1947-), Japanese Democratic Party politician, prime minister 2009-2010
Ishihara Jintarō (1932-), Japanese author and politician, governor of Tokyo since 1999
Kiichi Miyazawa (1919-2007), former Japanese prime minister
Hoover (name)/Herbert Hoover (1874-1964) US mining engineer and Republican politician, president (1929-1933)
MORI Yoshirō (1937-), Japanese rugby player and politician, prime minister 2000-2001, famous for numerous gaffes
Mahmoud Ahmadinejad (1956-), Iranian fundamentalist politician, president of Iran 2005-2013/abbr. for 艾哈邁迪內賈德|艾哈迈迪内贾德
